page.title: 10Changing Times
page.content: {CHANGING TIMES} The old Brynmawr railway station,goods yards and railway line were demolished in 1963.The old church and railway bridge over the Blaina Road have been pulled down.The Dunlop Semtex Factory was built on the same site but was closed three years ago.The new Heads of the Valley Road was completed in 1967.The Control Data factory was built in 1967.The Beaufort L.M.S. and the Ebbw Vale G.W.R. stations were demolished in the early 1960s.The Lower Cwm viaduct was blown up in 1965. The education system has changed from Grammar to Comprehensive.Two housing estates, Garnlydan and Rowan Way have been developed on the moorland to the north of the Heads of the Valleys Road.
